intro: Orbeopsis caudata, commonly known as the hairy orbeopsis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and are arranged in dense, spherical clusters, making it visually striking. Orbeopsis caudata is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
